Game¶

class simulate.game.Game(characters_setup: dict)¶

Bases: object

Manages game simulations, including setup, execution, and post-processing.

conf¶

Simulation configuration settings.

Type:

dict

characters_setup¶

Setup for characters in the simulation. Format: {agent_id: character, agent_id: type, …} Each key defines the character for that specific agent. If “all” is a key, all agents not mentioned will get that character.

Type:

dict

outfile_name¶

Name of the file to store simulation results.

Type:

str

simulations¶

List of Simulation instances.

Type:

list

output(results: list, filename: str) → None¶

Saves simulation results to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • results (list) – List of simulation results.

  • filename (str) – Filename to save the results.

run(override: bool) → None¶

Runs the simulations and passes results to output function.

If the results file exists and override is False, skips the simulation.

Parameters:

override (bool) – If True, runs simulations even if the output file exists.

setup_simulations() → None¶

Prepares simulations based on config and character setup.

simulate.game.play(sim: Simulation) → dict¶

Plays a simulation. This is just a function for parallel processing.

Parameters:

sim (Simulation) – A Simulation instance.

Returns:

The result of the simulation.

Return type:

dict
